derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bēte, of West Germanic origin, from Latin beta, perhaps of Celtic origin; related to Dutch beet and German Bete

entry.def: Beet is a crop with a thick round root. It is often used to feed animals, especially cows.

example.tran: 种甜玉米和甜菜的田地

entry.def: Beets are dark red roots that are eaten as a vegetable. They are often preserved in vinegar.

means.word_mean: 1. biennial Eurasian plant usually having a swollen edible root; widely cultivated as a food crop
